children.summary: Used to decorate xUnit.net test assemblies to indicate per-assembly fixture data. An instance of the fixture data is initialized before any test in the assembly are run (including if it's implemented). After all the tests in the assembly have been run, it is cleaned up by calling if it's implemented, or it falls back to if that's implemented. Assembly fixtures must have a public parameterless constructor. To gain access to the fixture data from inside the test, a constructor argument should be added to the test class which exactly matches the fixture type.
Captures output ( and/or ) and reports it to the test output helper.
Captures and output and reports it to the test output helper.
Provides a data source for a data theory, with the data coming from a class which must implement IEnumerable<object?[]>.
Used to declare a specific test collection for a test class.
Used to declare a specific test collection for a test class. Equivalent to using with the .
Defines the built-in behavior types for collections in xUnit.net.
Default implementation of .

Used to declare a test collection container class. The container class gives developers a place to attach interfaces like and that will be applied to all tests classes that are members of the test collection.
Attribute that is applied to a method to indicate that it is a fact that should be run by the default test runner.

Used to provide asynchronous lifetime functionality. Currently supported:

  • Test classes
  • Classes used in
  • Classes used in .
  • Classes used in [assembly: ()].

Used to decorate xUnit.net test classes and collections to indicate a test which has per-test-class fixture data. An instance of the fixture data is initialized just before the first test in the class is run (including if it's implemented). After all the tests in the test class have been run, it is cleaned up by calling if it's implemented, or it falls back to if that's implemented. Class fixtures may have a public constructor which is either empty, or accepts one or more assembly and/or collection fixture objects as constructor arguments. To gain access to the fixture data from inside the test, a constructor argument should be added to the test class which/ exactly matches the TFixture.

Used to decorate xUnit.net test classes and collections to indicate a test which has per-test-collection fixture data. An instance of the fixture data is initialized just before the first test in the collection is run (including if it's implemented). After all the tests in the collection have been run, it is cleaned up by calling if it's implemented, or it falls back to if that's implemented. Collection fixtures may have a public constructor which is either empty, or accepts one or more assembly fixture objects as constructor arguments. To gain access to the fixture data from inside the test, a constructor argument should be added to the test class which exactly matches the TFixture.
Represents the current state of the test pipeline.
Gives access to the current test context, which is considered to be an immutable snapshot of the current test state at the time it's retrieved.
Represents a class which can be used to provide test output.
Represents a single row of theory data, along with optional metadata attached to the row.
Provides a data source for a data theory, with the data coming from inline values.

children.summary: Represents theory data which is created from the merging of nine data streams by creating a matrix of the data.

Provides a data source for a data theory, with the data coming from one of the following sources:

  1. A public static property
  2. A public static field
  3. A public static method (with parameters)
Used to decorate an assembly, test collection, or test class to allow the use of a custom test case orderer.
Used to decorate an assembly to allow the use of a custom test collection orderer.

Represents information about the current state of the test engine. It may be available at various points during the execution pipeline, so consumers must always take care to ensure that they check for null values from the various properties.
Extension methods for .
Represents the current status of the execution of the test engine, with respect to a phase in the execution pipeline (for example, engine status for a test collection vs. test case vs. test).
Used to decorate an assembly to allow the use of a custom test framework.
A flag to indicate which part of the test pipeline you're in. Retrieved from an instance of .
Indicates the result of running the test.
Represents information about the current state of a test after it has run.

Marks a test method as being a data theory. Data theories are tests which are fed various bits of data from a data source, mapping to parameters on the test method. If the data source contains multiple rows, then the test method is executed multiple times (once with each data row). Data is provided by attributes which implement (most commonly, and ).
Represents an untyped set of data for a theory with an unknown number of parameters.
Provides a base type for theories based on collection initialization syntax.
Implementation of which accepts untyped pre-enumerated data.
Provide a base implemention of with settable properties and deferred data storage.
Extension methods for .
Implementation of which accepts one typed value.
